_header: All christian men that walk me by / Behold & see
Note:
See 3348, of which this is prologue; Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 114.
Subjects: adultery, tales of; laments, sinners’; prologues; sinner, lament of
_description: Lamentacio Peccatoris, Prologue to the Adulterous Falmouth Squire (3348), a lament for the soul of William Basterfield, Knight — 99 lines in the longest text, mostly in 8-line stanzas

BodAsh61.First Lines:
All crysten men þat walke by meBe hold & se þe
                    dulfull syȝhtIt helpys not to calle ne cryffor I am a dampned a
                    dollfole wyȝht …
BodAsh61.Last Lines:
…ffarewele I here an horn blow
                    I may no lenger byde with thee
BodAsh61.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             Altenglische Legenden: Neue Folge.
         Heilbronn: Henninger, 1881: 367-8, 529-30.
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Political, Religious and Love Poems, from Lambeth MS. 306 and other
                sources.

BodRawC813.First Lines:
All crysten men that walke me bybeholde and See thys dylfull
                    syght…
BodRawC813.Last Lines:
…Adewe I here a horne bloweAll cristen men bewarre by
                    me

OxfCCC237.First Lines:
All Cristen men that walkys me byBe hold and see this dolefull
                    sight…
OxfCCC237.Last Lines:
…ffare well I here an horne bloweAll Cristen men be ware by
                    me
OxfCCC237.Editions:
Fein,  Susanna Greer. 
             Moral Love Songs and Laments.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 1998.

NLS1931.First Lines:
All cristenmen þat walkes me byBe hald & see þis
                    dylfull sigth…
NLS1931.Last Lines:
…And drof an furght fro dey to deyÞer for i beyd hyr in
                    þes cage
NLS1931.Facsimiles:
Hardman,  Phillipa. 
             The Heege Manuscript: A Facsimile of National Library of Scotland MS
                Advocates 19.3.1.
         Leeds Texts and Monographs, n.s. 16. Leeds: School of English,
            2000.

Lincoln91.First Lines:
All crystyn men þat wawkes me byeBe hold & see þis
                    dulful seyghtI beyd nothere to kawl nor to cryeI am so dampyd a woful
                    weyght…
Lincoln91.Last Lines:
…Me thynk I heyr a horn bloweAll crystyn men bewar by
                    me

             The Thornton Manuscript (Lincoln Cathedral MS. 91).
